thread.title: Baylor WBB Trio Earns Big 12 Preseason Honors
thread.title_full: Baylor WBB Trio Earns Big 12 Preseason Honors

title: Baylor WBB Trio Earns Big 12 Preseason Honors
text:
Baylor WBB Trio Earns Big 12 Preseason Honors Posted: Updated: 
The Big 12 Conference has announced its Preseason All-Big 12 Team as well as honors for preseason player, newcomer and freshman of the year for the 2015-16 women’s basketball season. The awards are chosen by head coaches, who are not allowed to vote for their own student-athletes. 
Nina Davis (Baylor) was named Preseason Player of the Year while her teammate Alexis Jones (Baylor) was honored as Preseason Newcomer of the Year and Lashann Higgs (Texas) was selected Preseason Freshman of the Year. 
Joining Davis on the Preseason All-Big 12 Team are Niya Johnson (Baylor) , Gabbi Ortiz (Oklahoma), Brittney Martin (Oklahoma State), Zahna Medley (TCU) and Bria Holmes (West Virginia). Six players were honored due to a tie in the voting. Davis was last season’s Big 12 Player of the Year while Ortiz garned Freshman of the Year honors. Davis , Johnson , Martin, Medley and Holmes were members of the 2014-15 All-Big 12 First Team. 
Davis was a unanimous All-America and All-Big 12 First Team selection as a sophomore in helping the Lady Bears to the 2014-15 Big 12 regular season and postseason titles along with an Elite Eight appearance. She was also selected the Most Outstanding Player of the Phillips 66 Big 12 Women’s Basketball Championship for the second-consecutive season. Davis led the Big 12 in scoring (21.1) and double-doubles (12) a year ago, was second in field goal percentage (.584) and fourth in rebounding (8.3). The junior forward was a member of the USA World University Games Team that captured a gold medal during the summer of 2015. The honor marks the sixth time a Baylor player has been selected as Big 12 Preseason Player of the Year; 2013-14 - Odyssey Sims, 2010-11, 2011-12, 2012-13 - Brittney Griner, 2005-06 - Sophia Young. 
Jones started all 64 games in which she played at Duke and was chosen as an all-conference second team selection as a sophomore and freshman of the year the previous season. In 2013-14, she averaged 13.1 points, 5.3 assists and 4.1 rebounds prior to a late-season ACL injury. Jones guided the 2013 USA U19 World Championship Team to a 9-0 record and a gold medal. After redshirting last year, she will be a junior guard on the 2015-16 Lady Bears’ squad. Jones becomes the fifth Lady Bear to be named Big 12 Preseason Newcomer of the Year; 2010-11 -Brooklyn Pope, 2006-07 - Bernice Mosby, 2000-01 - Sheila Lambert, 1997-98 - Lara Webb. 
Johnson received her first Big 12 Conference preseason recognition as part of the Preseason All-Big 12 Team. The senior guard averaged 7.3 points and 5.0 rebounds a game in addition to setting a Big 12 Conference single-season assist record (322). In additionally she ranked No. 1 nationally in assists per game at 8.9 and was No. 2 in assist/turnover ratio (4.1) which set a Big 12 single season record. 
With Davis and Johnson’s selection to the Preseason All-Big 12 team, Baylor has now had five duos honored; 2001-02 - Sheila Lambert & Danielle Crockrom, 2010-11 - Brittney Griner & Melissa Jones, 2011-12 & 2012-13 – Brittney Griner & Odyssey Sims, 20115-15 – Nina Davis & Niya Johnson. 
Higgs finished her prep career as a consensus All-American at Cedar Ridge High School in Round Rock, Texas. She was the No. 7-ranked recruit and No. 3 guard in the class of 2015 according to ESPN.com. Higgs was named a high school Naismith Trophy finalist as a senior when she averaged 27.0 points, 9.0 rebounds and 5.0 assists in leading her team to a 30-3 record. 
The Big 12 Women’s Basketball Preseason Poll will be announced on October 14. A Big 12 Women’s Basketball Preview Show will be televised on FOX Sports affiliates prior to the beginning of regular season games. The first airing is scheduled for Monday, November 9 at 7:00 p.m. CT on FOX Sports Southwest. 
2015-16 BIG 12 CONFERENCE WOMEN’S BASKETBALL PRESEASON AWARDS 
(coaches not allowed to vote for own players) 
Preseason Player of the Year 
Nina Davis, Baylor, F, 5-11, Jr, Memphis, Tenn. 
Preseason Newcomer of the Year Alexis Jones, Baylor, G, 5-9, Jr, Irving, Texas 
Preseason Freshman of the Year Lashann Higgs, Texas, G, 5-9, Fr, Round Rock, Texas 
Preseason All-Big 12 Team 
Nina Davis - Baylor/F/5-11/Jr-2L/21.1 ppg/8.3 rpg/Memphis, Tenn. 
Niya Johnson - Baylor/G/5-8/Sr/3L/7.3 ppg/5.0 rpg/Gainesville, Fla. 
Gabbi Ortiz - Oklahoma/G/5-9/So-1L/8.2ppg/3.7rpg/Racine, Wis. 
Brittney Martin - Oklahoma State/G/6-0/Sr-3L/13.4 ppg/8.8 rpg/Syracuse, Utah 
Zahna Medley - TCU/G/5-6/Sr-3L/15.6 ppg/ 2.6rpg/Springfield, Ill. 
Bria Holmes - West Virginia/G/6-1/Sr-3L/18.8 ppg/4.4rpg/New Haven, Conn. 
Honorable Mention (listed alphabetically by school) 
Alexis Jones (Baylor), Breanna Lewis (K-State), Gioya Carter (Oklahoma), Peyton Little (Oklahoma), Kaylon Williams (Oklahoma), Veja Hamilton (TCU), Ariel Atkins (Texas), Imani Boyette (Texas), Kelsey Lang (Texas). Sports - Latest News More>>
